traceability.evidence: All 142 Vitest tests pass (including CLI JSON format tests and json-formatter unit tests). • CLI accepts --format=json (test/cli.format-json.test.js) • JSON output is valid and parseable (JSON.parse assertions) • Output includes timestamp, packages array, and summary object (asserted in CLI tests) • stderr is empty in JSON mode (suppresses console noise) • Invalid format values exit code 2 with error message (test/cli-entrypoint.test.js) • JSON error output includes error object with message, code, details (test/cli.format-json.error.test.js) • Help text lists --format option (bin/dry-aged-deps.js help section) • Default behavior remains table format when no --format supplied (existing table output tests remain unchanged)
traceability.notes: The implementation fully satisfies the story’s acceptance criteria for JSON output: the CLI flag, valid JSON schema, summary statistics, exit codes for success and errors, silent stderr, format validation, and help documentation are all covered by automated tests. Therefore, this user story is complete.
